Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant with bright green leaves to show it has enough water and light.
The student can draw a plant with wilted or brown leaves to show it does not have enough water.
The student can use arrows to indicate the sun shining on the plant, showing it needs light.
The student can include raindrops or a watering can in their drawing to indicate the plant's need for water.
The student can use different colors to represent healthy and unhealthy plants.
The student can draw a comparison side-by-side of a healthy plant and an unhealthy plant to show what happens when plants do and do not get water and light.
